It's seems a bit overpowered if the recipe just involves a horn and copper. What if the recipe used echo shards as well? Echo shards need a better use than the recovery compass and it sort of fits, doesn't it? A spooky treasure found in a dangerous place that can be used to teleport mobs to us. It would allow this tool to be a mid-game item that you can get before the end, it's really useful and it adds another reason to go to an ancient city. It's perfect. 

Pets and mounts would be: Wolves, cats, pigs, horses, donkeys, mules and ghasts, right?

i think the teleport mechenic can be for pets,happy ghasts and horses only though becuse than the happy ghast's use would be completly useless,i do think that having the copper horn alone even without the telport mechenic can be fun and makes sense for the them.

i do want the horn to be played by a dispenser or a noteblock too tho so even more musical opportunitys can be created in game!

yes, maybe letting you teleport any valid mob, not just mounts, by binding it to it, similarly as compass gets bound to lode stones, so only last mob you bind would be summoned, if it would work only on mounts, then last mob you did ride would, it would be preferable over closest mount for multiplayer, also to not call random horse that is just block closer than your desired one, and I guess game easier checks what is last ridden mob than which one is closest, but that is just my guess, it would also give reason why llamas could be ridden if it would put llama into "last ridden mob list"
however it do feel cheap to get if only horn and copper be mentioned, I think as someone told too, echo shard seems fitting thematically and also where it can be found, however maybe it is too hard to get those for mount summoning, when mount disappearing tends to be biggest issue in earlier game, but ancient cities can be explored also early on if you are lucky and know where to look for one, maybe resin from creakings could be used.. resin crafts into hearth and that binds creaking so logic could be there and resin would have use besides building block, it would be also available early in progression but not as easily
as whole it isnt really OP as it still puts your mob in danger at least when called to place, could have some cooldown, could summon only one mob so you couldnt bring herd of llamas at once for example, maybe it having durability

This is a wonderful Idea! I recommend allowing the corner shelf blocks to only be capable of holding two items instead of three (the edge is wooden instead of open). This will also enhance the variety of using the shelves as they are actually intended. I created an account to upvote this.
This would be amazing for buildingüòç
amazing idea! I love the idea of shelves but I find it limiting as a trim/aesthetic block when they arent able to wrap around blocks like how a stair would around a angled/circular wall.

Having optional side tiers (ie. gold) isn't neccesarily a bad thing in itself. If the copper remains as is, it would serve as a light general purpose upgrade to stone tools for players who aren't yet ready to search for iron. But I don't think I have a preference for either case; both are fine.
Yes
Update: MC Bedrock development versions are known as -preview-.

I fully agree with this idea; requiring players to craft a copper pickaxe to mine iron ore would have copper tools see some real use instead of being skipped over. Here‚Äôs my take on the idea:

As it is, both copper and iron ore can be mined using a stone pickaxe. And, because both copper and iron are very common and generate at similar y-levels, there is little incentive to make copper tools. Iron tools are superior to copper in every way, and there‚Äôs just no reason to mine and smelt copper when you could mine and smelt iron instead. If nothing is done with copper tools to make them more useful and unique, they will end up being ignored just as hard as gold tools are, and bloat the game with more useless items.

Requiring a copper pickaxe to mine iron ore would incentivize players to make and use copper tools. It would give copper a necessary role in progression, add more content to the early game, and spice up the ore progression tree, which has remained stagnant for well over a decade (excluding Netherite).

Admittedly, this isn‚Äôt a full solution to the problem. If this change were implemented, and copper pickaxes were needed to mine iron, the two ores generate so often and near each other that copper would fall into the same boat as wooden tools. Copper tools would become transitional items that are created and discarded within minutes, without seeing any real use.

Along with this change, the distribution of iron ore generation would also need to change to balance the early game.
this seems like...really redundant and just adds another tool requirement to the chain
I think the fact that copper is optional for that is better

But then you would not be able to get iron before getting copper. This would make the game more complicated and new players using toutorials that are set before this feature would not understand. Meaning there could be less players.
I think a better alternative is a small chance of 2 iron with copper to make it more used, without disrupting other tools.

I think it would be better to make copper tools have a small chance to drop 2 raw iron so people are more incentived to get copper tools but aren't forced to by completely changing how Minecraft has worked for years and years
Wouldn't it be better for them to implement tin and Bronze? So you will need Bronze to mine Iron. Just to add a bit more to the progression of the game. It gives you a reason to gather copper

If Copper Tools was buffed and Stone got Nerfed. Please buff also Copper which it can mine Gold Ores, and Gold Pickaxe can mine Iron, Gold and Copper Ores to make these tools put at good use too. Please increase also the damage of Gold Tools that's equal to Copper itself. Gold Tools was left behind. Also I remember this Gold Armor has special ability which makes you welcome to piglins, add special ability to copper which makes the wearer of it become Lightning Rod but instead of getting damaged from Lightning, it makes the user become charged like creepers so if mobs or players tried to hurt the wearer of Copper Armor they will be hurt also for once but the damage is ‚Öï of the damage back from the attacker, which example was 10 damage/5 heart damage. The attacker will receive half heart or 2 damage if the user was charged by lightning, but when user was hit once, the charged effect will worn off immediately while it damaged the attacker at the same time.

I completely agree.
Wood should only be able to mine stone, stone should only be able to mine coal and copper, copper should be able to mine redstone, lapis, and iron, & iron should be able to mine diamond and gold, and finally as always diamond mines obsidian.

yep i agree. in fact the funny thing is lime already has a counterbalence against red and green, and purple, magenta, and pink look close to eachother anyway. and who has heard of grey-(insert colour here) colourblindness? so the change is redundent, unlike... +1 Yeah I really like the idea of putting the dyes on a little dish to indicate "this is a dye" but the individual dyes just lost so much personality and visual distinctiveness.
Completly agree

I messed around with dye stuff in the snapshot for an hour and I kept getting all the different colors mixed up because of how similar and indistinct all the shapes all the shapes were to/from each other. If that was happening to me and I'm not even color blind, it has be way worse for actual color blind people this is supposedly supposed to help. The best solution probably would be to just change all the oval dyes (lime, purple, magenta, and pink) and keep all the other ones the same as always.
I find it ridiculous that they change the sprites of the dyes just because the datanics do not recognize them if in the first place THEY DO NOT RECOGNIZE THEM
Totally agree. Especially the "paper" that they are on doesn't really fit.

I heavily agree. They should have just made new textures for the identically shaped dyes. They're all just similarly shaped blobs now that are hard to tell apart from each other. Also I really don't like the piece of paper they added under each one. It makes the texture more cluttered and makes it harder to use them to decorate in creative ways.

It feels weird how they‚Äôre seemingly ignoring all feedback regarding the dye textures, especially when compared to the ore texture changes in Caves and Cliffs, where the texture artist was actively responding to feedback from colorblind people.

They haven‚Äôt made a single change to the dye textures since the snapshot that were added in.

I really like the old textures, the dish underneath seems unnecessary and makes it look cluttered, and it means for server owners you can't really use the colours in chest inventory guis (for instance red/green dye for confirm/cancel)
They wouldn't need to be faster. Cheaper already makes them better.

I disagree, currently, minecarts, because of how slow they are don'tmake sense for the player to use. Since you can sprint jump to go faster then minecarts right now. Which is a little pathetic.

So, because of how expensive and slow they are, minecarts definitely need a price drop and speed increase.

Misspelled copper, but I love the idea

Well, there are 'fire dyes' that change fire color. What if right-clicking with a copper nugget made a green camp-fire? Then lapis gives us blue, amethyst gives us purple, and eventually we will find all the other colors.
You misspelled torch if you were wondering, but I also think that instead of logs and sticks it can have copper bars and copper ingots.

Copper Power Generator - Not a movement system, but more like a furnace. It needs a fuel that eventually runs out. Lightning strikes charge it, or it eats xp / redstone. 

Copper Wiring - yes please. Redstone between to copper for a lightning-rod-like item that is half-strength compared to redstone dust unless connected to a power-generator.

Copper Timer - no, actually updated the clock into a placable item and then set an alarm. This would give new use to the item and provide a new decorative block. 

Tesla Coil - random wireless redstone activation? IDK i just think it would be super cool decorative block. Really add to the steampunk vibes going here.

Spring Block - hurls anything that steps on it into the air, or throws anything that walks into it in the opposite direction. right-click to place an item that you want to disguise it as - i.e. grass block to make it look like grass. 

Copper Wrench - not advanced but pretty necessary to make placing these items easier. It rotates blocks and has durability like all other tools. But this means you don't have to do weird scaffolding to place a block the right way. Like other tools, it deals damage and can be enchanted. 

Copper Coil - to craft the Tesla Coil and Spring Block.
That would be more accurate
I can see it! Good idea.

This seems like it would break the vanilla feel. My take on this:

You could right-click on a golem with specific items which slightly alter their appearance, and will change the functionality. Examples:

- Use paper to make them group "items of the same material" (as OP put it), so group it by item tags

- Use a book to make them group by creative inventory tab, like OPs function categorising

- Add more sorting methods since I am not very creative

- Remove any modifier with shears or maybe a copper ingot

- Additionally, this will work best with an option to have a "default" chest, for all items that could not be sorted into the other chests 

I don't know how good this will feel in game and whether it is a good addition, but I think this approach is at least a bit more vanilla-fitting than OP's.

Hi! OP here! I like your ideas and I agree that they're more vanilla, but I feel like it would be more confusing and lost on newer and non-media focused players.

To solve this copper golems with different specific items could be found in trial chambers so they're introduced to all players.

They could also be non-functioning until they're given their item, or maybe only sort one way until given a new item.

Also I think it would be better if the items were all redstone and metal based, like a repeater, compactor, hopper, anvil, dropper, etc

Copper Golem Statues can be right-clicked to reveal 9 slots. Place the items you want them to sort in those slots, then revive them. This gives you the option for all of those in a way that players who don't read wiki's are likely to quickly find out. 

Also, it gives you a new storage block - like a chest, it drops everything if you mine it.

I don't love it, but I do understand it, and I think it might be an appropriate inclusion. The progression tree should be consistent across all pickaxes, otherwise the gold sucks for no good reason. I'm still not voting because I'll need some incentive - copper would need to be as convenient as stone OR have something really cool going for it, I mean "oxidization level gives single use Unbreaking level" type of cool.
I like this! Mojang has been trying hard to add to the survival gameplay loop lately, and this is a sure-fire way to do it.
AGREED.

This thing was not required though.... what happened to mojang...what was their problem with the profile man.... i don't like this update... i mean everything was fine but what was the need to remove custom profiles.... I totally disagree with the new update!!
Agreed

Agreed.... Mojang needs to stop removing things that make the game a lot better... If the things that support creativity get removed... No one except maybe newbies or people who like the profile will play the game.

Agree!
Yes this should be an option and not just transparent stuff, an option for sugar cane, mobs, and glass I want the sugar cane but not anything else! also the tinted glass should still have A TINT!!!

In the real world, you can push plants away from your face, so it doesn‚Äôt feel as awful with the sugarcane. However, when you get close to a creature in real life you are never able to see through it! This breaks immersion. I‚Äôm dreading seeing my villagers go transparent when I run up to trade, or my pets when I come visit, or even my horse! Mobs should not be transparent in a first person game, if it‚Äôs an accessibility setting it should be toggleable to allow the game to stay the way it is for players who don‚Äôt need/want it.

I also think this for glass. For example, if you walk up to tinted glass, the tinted effect just.. disappears. It makes this item pretty useless, and this whole new transparent thing they are trying should just stop.

Was just about to post the exact same thing. Doors and trap doors all have different designs depending on what material they‚Äôre made from. My thought is they could either match the texture of the grate, or maybe have some sort of ornate wrought-iron-like design, or maybe that could be saved for something like gold bars. Either way, having them be identical to iron bars currently feels like sort of a waste.

No they shouldn't
Not trying to be rude but they mix very well with iron bars

having distinct copper and iron bars textures, as well as chain some other suggestion contained, is double edged weapon, on one side it makes more styles to build with, on other side it is harder to match different materials in one build, I do actually like that they are same as you can place them together in single build or even wall (in case of chain, line)


solution could be having more bars textures, I would like that with doors/trapdoors too, I like orange wood color for something but I want doors be more solid then ten sticks, so door style I consider more than door color for my builds (so I tend to use only three door types in all my builds), simialr issue could be with different chains and bars.. and if we will be lucky, we may get golden ones one day too so all metals get bars and chains

I agree
Just like copper oxidises, the torch should either change colour or get dimmer the more they are used
I think that giving the copper torch a different functionality from the default torch is a great idea!

Make the copper torch work underwater. This will fill a gap in underwater lighting, providing a early game alternative to lighting up oceans, instead of sea lanterns or pickles. It also fits with the connection between drowned and copper.
"This will fill a gap in underwater lighting" what gap? Lanterns work underwater and we even are getting more types.
Could make the light level lower when its underwater so it doesn't take away from the benefits of the conduit.

This idea doesn't make sense. The copper nugget doesn't protect the flame; it only changes it's color. It reflects real life in this way.

Btw, if you want an early-game underwater light source, try lanterns, either iron or copper.

Items and Tools
Copper Hammer ‚Äì crafting table, stone cutter and axe do that. Bundles can hold all these except the tool where they only fit one so you can have these tables around. If the hammer had some redstone functions as well it could be considered to put in your enderchest and pull it out when needed but only for crafting copper that is a little... you get it.

Copper Shield ‚Äì A shield that reflects projectiles with electricity when it reaches a certain level of oxidation. >> Could be a good idea for some kind of item to put in a slot in equipment like runes in diablo

Thunder Staff (with Copper and Amethyst) ‚Äì trident does this, I would welcome some original minecraft magic thou.

Copper Spikes (for armor) ‚Äì Thorns enchant does this

Copper Grenade ‚Äì why gunpowder? It does not explode, it shoots lightning as said and we already have that > the trident. Maybe they could add caltrops with their own enchants for electric damage? Those would be great area denial tools against mobswarms.

Conductive Blade ‚Äì Yet again trident. Maybe a copper specific enchantment that charges the coppersword while running around and for a couple of swings you deal bonus damage? This could make copper useful and then later you could upgrade it like you do diamond with ancient debris.
Yes, I agree. But there have to be alternatives otherwise we will stay the rest of the next 15 years of updates with the trident being the only one to do these functions

They need to add more weapons and playstyles anyway, some kind of Minecraft magic for example would already help. It is kinda weird that witches throw potions at you instead of turning you into a frog for a little while with a spell.

I would love to see actual spears (technically the trident is one but yeah it is a underwater weapon/fishing tool mostly), greatswords, hammers (we have a single one which is semi useful) of different sizes and some fitting enchants. Perhaps a spike-shield to hit enemies with so you can cause some effects on them.

We need more stuff to play around with in the game.

I hoenstly dont know what would be reaosn to need copper hammer unless you remove ability of axe to scrape rust from copper, it could help with accidental scraping by people using axes as weapons but that is only benefit of that unless it would do more (still there is lacking logic behind hammer doing those things compared to current ways it is done)

if you consider shield to reflect projectiles at attacker, given how easy is copper to obtain, it would be rather OP, unless balanced out by additional items acquired much later in game, copper shield could be fine as weaker/less durable version of shield, ironically only piece of gear copper could be reasonable choice over iron at least at begining, unlike all armor and tools they are adding

thunder staff could be fine, like early game trident functionality you later want to replace by trident anyway, if that would strike you and not work as magic wand casting lightnings at anything you point

spikes dont seem much desired given many people seem to even avoid thorns armor entirely, maybe gaving spikes you can place on ground made of copper would be fine, in past they rejected spikes but now we got dripstone spikes those work same

doubt grenade of any kind would be added

sword making lightning strikes into what you hit would be quite niche use, however weapon that would make some AoE kind of attack that would be like electricity arching between mobs could work, it should be however special weapon similarly to trident or mace

Okay, but as I said before, Minecraft can't focus on just having one weapon with one characteristic. It has to have several alternatives, otherwise we'll be stuck with swords, pickaxes, axes, and shovels for the next 15 years of updates. There have to be alternatives for all weapons, whether it's a trident or a mace.
Probably with a new featured lightning effects and behaviour where it doesn't set on fire/grief the world on intent.

I suggest simplifying this by giving all four variants the same mechanic with varying levels of strength. Out of the two mechanics you suggested, I think that copper pressure plates increasing in signal strength will be the most useful especially in game design as you would be able control how long a player has to wait in order to do something. Of course, you can already do this, however it will lead to more compacted redstone which is always welcome. The different variants will determine how long you have to wait to charge up the signal, shorter if normal, longer if oxidized. 

If you think about it, the second mechanic is practically a button. Perhaps different variants of copper buttons could have signal strengths that last longer.
Great idea! Your suggestion is a lot better than mine üòÖ

I just had this same idea! Copper Pressure Plates increasing in signal strength while something is pressing it down fits perfectly with the existing "vibe" of copper. I think for each stage of oxidation, there would be 1 extra redstone tick of delay between signal updates. So the normal plate would take 1.5 seconds to reach 15 signal strength (gaining 1 every 0.1 seconds), then for the other weatherings it would be 3 seconds, then 4.5 seconds, and finally 6 seconds for the fully oxidized plate. I really hope this gets seen & implemented!
And copper buttons! Which copper golems like pressing!
Voice chat and written chat for menu
Yes please
yeah better to have because i have to write on mobile
From Minecraft pe
We need more things added to Minecraft Bedrock, we need to hold everything just like Java players does in their offhand.
Entire mobs are too much this close to release. But copper horns, wrenches that rotate blocks, and a better copper-golem memory system seem doable.

I personally think having animal and passive mobs' heads in survival would be a bit violent for kids (if we have Mojang's perspective on the game).
But I'd love to have mob heads from enemies such as the blaze, breeze, Enderman, spider and so on.
